author: Gaspasser

review: It costs half that of a Roku 3, and does everything the 3 does except for the input on the 3's remote to plug in headphones. It's also a fraction the size of a Roku 3, and doesn't have to sit out in front of the TV all the time, as it plugs into and sits in the back where the USB ports are.It costs more than a Chromecast stick, but it comes with lots more apps and a remote that is way more useful than I first thought it would be.Adding channels activation codes, and inputting data like username, passwords is annoying because the only way to do it is by tapping one letter at a time on an on-screen keyboard... you only have to go through this once per channel or service that you want to add, but it can be a lengthy process. To solve this, Roku should offer the ability to take care of all the setup stuff via a computer browser, once signed into your Roku account.Bottom line is it's basically as good as the more expensive Roku 3, and way more functional than Chromecast for only $10 more. To me it's currently the clear winner of all the app streamers.Apple is missing from my comparison; of course, because everything about Apple TV it is way to proprietary for it to ever be in the final running to win this war.

review: We've only had it a few days and the remote is giving us tremendous problems.  We have re-started several times, unplugged, re-paired the remote with the roku box, you name it we have done it.  My son looked up the problem with the remote freezing up and found that the remote can "lose" the connection because of the Wi-Fi connection.  If other devices (computer, tablet etc...) are being used it can disconnect leaving the remote frozen.  It's totally frustrating and makes using it not satisfied with what we paid for.  Don't even know how to exchange remote if indeed the remote is flawed.  :(  :(

review: I hate to say it but this is so much better then the fire stick. We always used box style Roku's but started using a Amazon Fire stick when they first came out on a bedroom tv.  The firestick apps are just so limited right now.  You really don't have many to choose from. The roku has hundreds and hundreds of apps plus the ability to add private channels.  One thing that always bugged me about the firsestick was that it had no time warner cable app.  Roku's do so I am able to watch my cable from any tv it's hooked to.  The navigation and set up is also more user friendly on the Roku.  After using the firestick for 4 or 5 months it's just so nice to get back to a Roku and the stick form makes it easy to set up on a wall mount tv.  Maybe Amazon firesticks will be able to compete eventually when more apps and channels are available but for now Roku is the best on the market in my opinion.
